desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AppConfig
Default configuration for the “openedx.core.djangoapps.credit” Django application.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.external_user_ids.models module
section.paragraph: Models for External User Ids that are sent out of Open edX

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: TimeStampedModel
External ids are sent to systems or companies outside of Open edX. This allows us to limit the exposure of any given id.
An external id is linked to an internal id, so that users may be re-identified if the external id is sent back to Open edX.
desc_content.comment: no_pii: We store external_user_id here, but do not consider that PII under OEP-30.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist
Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned
Creates an ExternalId for the User of the type_name provided :param user: User to create the ID for :param type_name: Name of the type of ExternalId :type type_name: str

field_body.paragraph: Returns the external id that was created or retrieved (Bool): True if the External ID was created, False if it already existed

desc_content.paragraph: Creates ExternalIds in batch.
Given a list of users and a type_name, this method creates new external ids for users that do not already have one. Then returns a dictionary mapping user id with corresponding external id.

list_item.paragraph: users – List of User to create the IDs for
type_name (str) – Name of the type of ExternalId

definition_list_item.term: None if fails, otherwise ExternalIds mapped by User.id

field_body.paragraph: True if the user already has an external ID, False otherwise.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: TimeStampedModel
ExternalIdType defines the type (purpose, or expected use) of an external id. A user may have one id that is sent to Company A and another that is sent to Company B.

section.title: Module contents
section.paragraph: edX Platform support for external user IDs.
This package will be used to support generating external User IDs to be shared with outside parties.
